channel.title: DVD drive stops spinning
channel.description:
The dvd drive on my laptop has an odd problem. As you'd expect, it stops spinning after a while. This is fine as long as it's not reading from a cd/dvd, as it saves energy. But it's not fine when I'm copying data from a dvd to my HD, because the copying then stops and I have to start all over again. The same happens when I'm burning a dvd. It just stop spinning, even when it's reading or writing.
Is this a botched drive, or is it a software problem?

item.title: DVD drive stops spinning
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

runescape3dude:

I guess it must be overheating or something, or your drivers could be corrupted.

It’s not overheating. For some reason it thinks it’s ok to stop spinning, because once I browse the dvd or something similar it starts spinning again.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD drive stops spinning
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I guess it must be overheating or something, or your drivers could be corrupted.
